title: NBA Draft Recommender and Player Guesser
description: A full-stack web app built for DataHacks 2025 featuring an NBA draft recommender and Akinator-style legend guessing game, using React, Next.js, and machine learning on live NBA stats.

title: League of Legends Role Analysis and Predictor
description: A machine learning project analyzing 97,980 rows of pro League of Legends data to compare role impact and predict player roles using a random forest classifier with 69.89% accuracy.

title: Processed Levels of Food Between Grocery Stores Visualization
description: A data visualization project comparing levels of processed foods across grocery stores, highlighting nutritional differences through clear and engaging visual analysis.

title: Handwritten Digit Classifier (KNN + MNIST)
description: A handwritten digit classifier using K-Nearest Neighbors on the MNIST dataset, achieving high accuracy in image recognition through feature comparison and distance metrics.

title: Minigit
description: A simplified Git-like version control system built in Java with CLI support, featuring staging, branching, SHA-1-based object storage, and robust JUnit-tested version tracking.

title: PM2.5 Emissions Comparison of Vehicle Types in Urban India Analysis
description: A data analysis project comparing PM2.5 emissions across vehicle types in urban India, highlighting key contributors to air pollution using visualizations and statistical insights.

title: Horror Puzzle Game
description: A 2D puzzle platformer with jumpscares built in Unity, featuring custom shaders, showcased to 60+ attendees at the Video Game Development Club open house..

title: Parkour Fury
description: A 2D platformer game built with Python Arcade, featuring accurate collision mechanics and 100+ interactive sprites, awarded Best Beginner Project out of 20+ teams at Leland Hacks.

title: Dungeon Escape Platformer Game
description: A 2D platformer game built in Unity with C#, featuring precise mouse-controlled aiming and interactive tile-based environments, showcased to 200+ attendees at a UCLA gallery.
